00067    virtual bool IsEnabled() const { return mEnabled; }
00068    virtual void Disable();
00069    virtual void Enable();
00070    void SetEnabled(bool state) {
00071       state ? Enable() : Disable();
00072    }

00086    virtual bool WasShiftDown(); // returns true if shift was held down
00087                                 // the last time the button was clicked
00088    virtual bool WasControlDown(); // returns true if control was held down
00089                                   // the last time the button was clicked
00090    bool IsDown(){ return mButtonIsDown;}
00091    void SetButtonToggles( bool toggler ){ mToggle = toggler;}
00092    void Toggle(){ mButtonIsDown ? PopUp() : PushDown();}
00093    void Click();
00094    void SetShift(bool shift);

00097       AButtonUp,
00098       AButtonOver,
00099       AButtonDown,
00100       AButtonDis
00101    };

00116              ImageRoll over,

00120 
00121    bool mAlternate;
00122    bool mToggle;   // This bool, if true, makes the button able to
00123                    // process events when it is in the down state, and
00124                    // moving to the opposite state when it is clicked.
00125                    // It is used for the Pause button, and possibly
00126                    // others.  If false, it (should) behave just like
00127                    // a standard button.
00128 
00129    bool mWasShiftDown;
00130    bool mWasControlDown;

00149 #if wxUSE_ACCESSIBILITY

00151 class AButtonAx: public wxWindowAccessible
00152 {
00153 public:
00154    AButtonAx(wxWindow * window);
00155 
00156    virtual ~ AButtonAx();
00157 
00158    // Performs the default action. childId is 0 (the action for this object)
00159    // or > 0 (the action for a child).
00160    // Return wxACC_NOT_SUPPORTED if there is no default action for this
00161    // window (e.g. an edit control).
00162    virtual wxAccStatus DoDefaultAction(int childId);
00163 
00164    // Retrieves the address of an IDispatch interface for the specified child.
00165    // All objects must support this property.
00166    virtual wxAccStatus GetChild( int childId, wxAccessible** child );
00167 
00168    // Gets the number of children.
00169    virtual wxAccStatus GetChildCount(int* childCount);
00170 
00171    // Gets the default action for this object (0) or > 0 (the action for a child).
00172    // Return wxACC_OK even if there is no action. actionName is the action, or the empty
00173    // string if there is no action.
00174    // The retrieved string describes the action that is performed on an object,
00175    // not what the object does as a result. For example, a toolbar button that prints
00176    // a document has a default action of "Press" rather than "Prints the current document."
00177    virtual wxAccStatus GetDefaultAction( int childId, wxString *actionName );
00178 
00179    // Returns the description for this object or a child.
00180    virtual wxAccStatus GetDescription( int childId, wxString *description );
00181 
00182    // Gets the window with the keyboard focus.
00183    // If childId is 0 and child is NULL, no object in
00184    // this subhierarchy has the focus.
00185    // If this object has the focus, child should be 'this'.
00186    virtual wxAccStatus GetFocus( int *childId, wxAccessible **child );
00187 
00188    // Returns help text for this object or a child, similar to tooltip text.
00189    virtual wxAccStatus GetHelpText( int childId, wxString *helpText );
00190 
00191    // Returns the keyboard shortcut for this object or child.
00192    // Return e.g. ALT+K
00193    virtual wxAccStatus GetKeyboardShortcut( int childId, wxString *shortcut );
00194 
00195    // Returns the rectangle for this object (id = 0) or a child element (id > 0).
00196    // rect is in screen coordinates.
00197    virtual wxAccStatus GetLocation( wxRect& rect, int elementId );
00198 
00199    // Gets the name of the specified object.
00200    virtual wxAccStatus GetName( int childId, wxString *name );
00201 
00202    // Returns a role constant.
00203    virtual wxAccStatus GetRole( int childId, wxAccRole *role );
00204 
00205    // Gets a variant representing the selected children
00206    // of this object.
00207    // Acceptable values:
00208    // - a null variant (IsNull() returns TRUE)
00209    // - a list variant (GetType() == wxT("list"))
00210    // - an integer representing the selected child element,
00211    //   or 0 if this object is selected (GetType() == wxT("long"))
00212    // - a "void*" pointer to a wxAccessible child object
00213    virtual wxAccStatus GetSelections( wxVariant *selections );
00214 
00215    // Returns a state constant.
00216    virtual wxAccStatus GetState(int childId, long* state);
00217 
00218    // Returns a localized string representing the value for the object
00219    // or child.
00220    virtual wxAccStatus GetValue(int childId, wxString* strValue);
00221 
00222 };
